title: Japan Airlines says to set up low-cost carrier
text:
May 14, 2018 / 2:46 AM / Updated 16 minutes ago Japan Airlines says to set up low-cost carrier Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
TOKYO (Reuters) - Japan Airlines Co Ltd (JAL) ( 9201.T ) said on Monday it would set up a low-cost carrier offering medium to long-haul flights. A Japan Airlines Boeing 777-300ER lands at San Francisco International Airport, San Francisco, California, February 14, 2015. REUTERS/Louis Nastro/File Photo
The new airline will be based at Narita International Airport and will offer flights to Asia, Europe and the Americas, JAL said in a statement.
Budget flights have been slow to take off in Japan, which is dominated by full-service carriers JAL and ANA Holdings Inc ( 9202.T ) and has a sophisticated high-speed rail network, but with growing numbers of Asia travellers taking to the air the two Japanese airlines are looking to expand their low-cost offerings. Reporting by Sam Nussey
